result.execSummary:
The defendant Coty Vr Konicki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation ordered as to Case 16CF01089. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
**Restitution is set at $0 (zero).
***NO contact order with Rosemary K. unless both the victim and probation agent agree to contact; then contact to be no VIOLENT contact (no contact ordered as a condition of probation on Case 16CF01089)
****Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the amended charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by EXPUNGEMENT. Court will grant expungement if there are no further violations of the law and upon successful completion of the probation sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Coty Vr Konicki

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: *Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the amended charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by EXPUNGEMENT. Court will grant expungement if there are no further violations of the law and upon successful completion of the probation sentence.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the amended charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court will grant expungement if there are no further violations of the law and upon successful completion of the probation sentence.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with Attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve  45  days in the House of Correction with credit for  16  days served; STRAIGHT time. 
-  No Contact Order with Rosemary K. unless both the victim and probation agent agree to contact; then contact to be no VIOLENT contact. (No Contact ordered as a condition of probation on Case# 16CF001089)
-  Restitution is set at $0 (zero)
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation ordered as to Case# 16CF001089.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders case 15cf5102 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 28, Judge Sanders.  

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  On motion of the State, Court AMENDS the charge to Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1) a class B misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Coty Vr Konicki not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Defendant has three cases before the court.  Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Court order case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:

Defense counsel unable to appear in court on March 17.  Case adjourned to March 18, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. for status.

Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with Attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel is requesting adjournment of today's scheduled plea hearing.  Discussion with the parties.
Court advises parties that there will be no further negotiations after the next court date and orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Court reviews reports with the defendant.
Clerk:  jms

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  Court will review with the parties on the next court date.
Clerk:  jms
Plea date scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with Attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea hearing.  Case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Coty Vr Konicki not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not produced.  Defendant also picked up a new case.

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense needs to provide the State with a report.  Matter adjourned for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney informs the Court that the defendant had his time mixed up for this court date.  Court issued a bench warrant but STAYED the issuance of the bench warrant until next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial and Attorney Jude ill.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defese is working towards a DPA. Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Newly appointed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court will amend bail conditions as follows:

Defendant is removed from JusticePoint monitoring.  Signature bond remains as previously set.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Jeanette Parmentier.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21 for scheduling conference.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated June 24, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ROSEMARY K. OR HER RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Coty Vr Konicki in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
